title: Official and facsimile ballots
context: PART VIII. BALLOTS §11-111 Official and facsimile ballots. Ballots issued by the chief election officer in state elections and by the clerk in county elections are official ballots. In elections using the paper ballot and electronic voting systems, the chief election officer or clerk in the case of county elections shall have printed informational posters containing facsimile ballots which depict the official ballots to be used in the election. The precinct officials shall post the informational posters containing the facsimiles of the official ballots near the entrance to the polling place where they may be easily seen by the voters prior to voting. [L 1970, c 26, pt of §2; am L 1973, c 217, §1(ee); am L 1975, c 36, §1(4); am L 1980, c 264, §1(f)] Cross References Ballot boxes, see §11-134. Spoiled ballots, see §11-140. Case Notes Constitutional amendment ballot form found defective. 60 H. 324, 590 P.2d 543.
